Package ElectronicAssetTradingPlatform.AssetTrading

Class OrganisationalUnit

java.lang.Object
ElectronicAssetTradingPlatform.AssetTrading.OrganisationalUnit
public class OrganisationalUnit
extends java.lang.Object
Class for the organisational units which are individual departments in the organisation e.g. Human Resources or Management or Public Relations etc. These are the organisational units in which the users will belong in, and will use their unit's assets and credits to perform exchanges on this platform

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    OrganisationalUnit​(java.lang.String name, float credits)
    Constructor for an organisational unit

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAsset​(java.lang.String assetName, int quantityToAdd)
    Given an existing asset object (has been created by IT admins) and a quantity of the asset in integers, add the asset name as the key and quantity as the value into the organisationalUnitAssets' TreeMap collection IF the organisation does not own any amount of the asset yet.
    void editCredits​(double credits)
    Given an integer of credits, add this onto the existing amount of credits an organisational unit owns However, cannot reduce credits by more than the organisational unit owns (can't go negative) This is the base helper function for all other methods elsewhere which add/subtract organisational unit credits [M]
    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getAssetsOwned()
    Getter for the assetsOwned field
    double getCredits()  
    void removeAllAssets()  
    void removeAsset​(java.lang.String assetName, int quantityToRemove)
    Given an existing asset object (has been created by IT admins) and a quantity of the asset in integers, reduce the quantity of the asset owned in the organisationalUnitAssets' TreeMap collection, where the asset name is the Key and quantity is the Value.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrganisationalUnit

      public OrganisationalUnit​(java.lang.String name, float credits)
      Constructor for an organisational unit
      Parameters:
      name - The organisational unit's name
      credits - The number of credits the organisational unit starts with/currently owns when created

  • Method Details

    • editCredits

      public void editCredits​(double credits) throws java.lang.Exception
      Given an integer of credits, add this onto the existing amount of credits an organisational unit owns However, cannot reduce credits by more than the organisational unit owns (can't go negative) This is the base helper function for all other methods elsewhere which add/subtract organisational unit credits [M]
      Parameters:
      credits - int amount of credits to add (positive int) or remove (negative int)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - exception handling so that net credits cannot be less than zero

    • addAsset

      public void addAsset​(java.lang.String assetName, int quantityToAdd)
      Given an existing asset object (has been created by IT admins) and a quantity of the asset in integers, add the asset name as the key and quantity as the value into the organisationalUnitAssets' TreeMap collection IF the organisation does not own any amount of the asset yet. Otherwise, add onto the existing quantity value in the TreeMap [M]
      Parameters:
      assetName - Asset object which an organisational unit owns/going to own
      quantityToAdd - Number of that particular asset to be added (must be greater than 0)

    • removeAsset

      public void removeAsset​(java.lang.String assetName, int quantityToRemove) throws java.lang.Exception
      Given an existing asset object (has been created by IT admins) and a quantity of the asset in integers, reduce the quantity of the asset owned in the organisationalUnitAssets' TreeMap collection, where the asset name is the Key and quantity is the Value. [M] The asset name should be unique and the quantity removed should not reduce the asset below zero
      Parameters:
      assetName - String asset which an organisational unit owns
      quantityToRemove - Number of that particular asset to be removed (must be less than number owned currently)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - // not enough assets owned to be removed
      java.lang.Exception - // organisational unit does not have the asset (cannot remove asset that is not owned)

    • removeAllAssets

      public void removeAllAssets()

    • getCredits

      public double getCredits()

    • getAssetsOwned

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getAssetsOwned()
      Getter for the assetsOwned field
      Returns:
      A map of the asset_name and quantity for this unit's assets
